page.title: 03INDUSTRY IN WALKER
page.content: We saw{HMS Ark Royal}leave{dock}and sail out of the R Tyne.It is an aircraft carrier.It had an old Sword_ fish biplane on its deck and a West_ land helicopter flew overhead.All the men aboard were alert and standing to attention and when we waved they waved back.John Mills{Brassworks,}housed in a NE Railway building of 1889,sells parts mainly to the{shipyards.}John Mills used to live in Orchard St. Newcastle where George Stephenson had lived.Tommy Purvis has worked in his {timber yard}in Walkergate for 30 yrs. The yard has been there for 70 yrs on the site of a millhouse built in l820. Mr Purvis gets his wood from {Northumberland}and does supply and repair work locally.
